704122f-c.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - 27th Street (East)
704122f-c.text:
(1)
Emmons Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 27th Street, sho ing the
Twppan's Hotel from 1860-1873. It was conducted as a restaurant by
Stephen and Gaskin in 1922. It ceased to be a restaurant in 1933,
when Mr. Stephen boarded up the place.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, she ing a front view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, another view.
DDecember 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same, sho ing also the outbuildings. This hotel was started :
by Jeremiah Tappan in 1845,,and was prominent in the horse racing days
as "Judge Tappan's Roadhouse. George C. Tappan, the son of Jeremiah
was the owner until his death.
December 1923.
Engene L. Armbruster Collection.

702686f-a.title: Brooklyn: 27th Street (East) - Emmons Avenue
702686f-a.text:
2765-2761 E. 27th Street, east side, between Emmons and
Vorhies Avenues, showing two cottages still in existence in
Sheepshead Bay.
About 1928.
Gift of V.J. Yannacohe

704123f-b.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - 27th Street (East)
704123f-b.text:
(1)
Emmons Ave., at the N.W. corner of East 27th Street. This is
the former Tappens Hotel, known as an eating place, throughout the
United States. It closed its doors in 1933 and has not reopened.
July 13, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)  The same, showing the other buildings connected with the
Hotel.
July 13, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, from another angle.
July 1S, 1933.
P. L. Sperr,

704121f-a.title: Brooklyn: Emmons Avenue - 27th Street (East)
704121f-a.text:
(1)
Emmons Ave., north side, west of East 27th Street, showing 'Judge
Tappan's Roadhouse' in the foreground.
December 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, a clower view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
